channel.title: Differential-Equations on Littleroot
channel.description: Recent content in Differential-Equations on Littleroot

item.title: Partial Differential Equations
item.description:
Partial diffential equations

A partial differential equation (PDE) is an identity that relates the independent variables, $x,y,\ldots$, the dependent variable $u$, i.e., $u(x,y,\ldots)$, and the partial derivative of $u$. Specifically, denoting the order of an equation is the highest derivate that appears, here are the most general PDE in two independent variables of first and second order \begin{equation} F(x,y,u(x,y),u_x(x,y),u_y(x,y))=F(x,y,u_x,u_y)=0 \end{equation} and \begin{equation} F(x,y,u,u_x,u_y,u_{xx},u_{xy},u_{yy})=0, \end{equation} where $u_x=\partial u/\partial x,u_{xy}=\partial^2 u/\partial x\partial y$.
